superseding_details.unit_reference: Approval 240179FUL to include a change of use to B2 (motorcycle service/repairs/MOT)
superseding_details.component_description: Approval 240179FUL to include a change of use to B2 (motorcycle service/repairs/MOT)

description: Change of use to include motorcycle service/repairs/MOT 9Use Class B2) in addition to current use Sui Generis (motorcycle showroom)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings:
Site Location Plan, Drawing No. 2327_P010, dated 15 October 2023
Exist/Prop Block Plan, Drawing No. 2327_P011, dated 15 October 2023
Existing Ground Floor, Drawing No. 2327_P012, Rev. B, dated 15 October 2023
Existing Elevation, Drawing No. 2327_P021, Rev. B, dated 19 December 2023
Proposed Ground Floor, Drawing No. 2327_P012, Rev.C, dated 15 October 2023
Signage Plan, prepared by Authentic Signspoint
Noise Management Plan, prepared by Wael Shekho, dated 21 August 2024

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interest of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| The internal and external rating sound level from the use of the premises including plant, machinery or equipment shall be limited and mitigated in accordance with the assessment and recommendations by Aran Acoustics, in their Noise Survey report ref.RP.240207.5, last dated 12/08/2024, with all plant items operating together at maximum capacity, and in accordance with the amended Noises:  Management Plan dated 21/08/2024 attached to email dated 9.9.2024 by Senan Selman. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation/ use of plant/ machinery/ equipment and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management
Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing
Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan
(2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023)

| Prior to use, machinery, plant and equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason:  To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policies  7A of the Ealing
Development Management DPD and Policy D14 of the London Plan
| The use of the premises shall not be permitted outside of the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 Mondays to Saturdays nor at any time on Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise from activities or people attending the site, in accordance with Policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing
Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and
1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), Policy D14 of the London
Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2023).

| Prior to use of the workshop, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of the installation, operation, and maintenance of a suitable arrestment plant to the extract system for vehicle engine and paint fumes. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently maintained and retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by dust, fumes, smoke, steam, smell or gas, in accordance with Policy D14 of the London Plan and Policy 7A of the Ealing
Development Management DPD.
| No motor vehicles shall be operated on the premises except at times of
departure and arrival at the street side of the property.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site and at
surrounding premises is not adversely affected by fumes, smoke, smell or other
emissions, in accordance with policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development
Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the
Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London
Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2023) and Ealing SPG10.
